text:
We have been using tomcat for the past one year and so far we found that all 
our web based applications working well with that.Now we found some bugs which 
we are unaable to resolve it.We are in the process of doing an airline 
ticketing project.We use JSP/java beans/servlets with tomcat as web server.In 
this project our server sends request to another server to get response.And 
before the response could come the tomcat in our server shuts down 
automatically.And we can see in the screen the following :

Internal Server Error:
The server encountered an internal error or unable to complete your 
request.Please contact the server administrator and inform them of the time the 
error occured and anthing you might have done that might have caused the error.

We are unable to trace out why this happens.Every time we send request after a 
minute or so we get response time out error and immediately after that we found 
that tomcat shut down.Please explain us what are the possibilities  that such 
errors could happen.And we would be glad if we could get a positive reponse 
from you as early as possible.
Thank You
creator: vemanap@yahoo.com
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I don't recall any known problems in Tomcat 3.2 that resulted in spurious
shutdowns.  I do recall a couple of instances where a bean used by a JSP was
calling System.exit() in response to an error, which will have this effect.

I would highly recommend trying Tomcat 3.2.2, if you haven't already, to see if
the problem still persists there.  It is at 3.2.3 where any bug fix would have
to occur anyway.  Please update this bug report with your results.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Not enough data, we can't reproduce it. Please reopen the bug with more
informations if you believe it's a tomcat problem.
